items.title: Exercise 1: Crisis Email (Doc A)
items.text:
Doc A â€” Urgent Internal Update

Subject: URGENT: Office Connectivity Issues & BCP Activation

Hi all,

Please be advised that our primary internet provider is currently experiencing a major regional outage. As a result, office connectivity is down.

Immediate Actions:
1. We have triggered our BCP (Business Continuity Plan).
2. A manual workaround has been implemented for urgent client payments; please use the secure offline terminal in the Finance office.
3. Staff are requested to switch to mobile hotspots or work from home if their tasks are not location-dependent.

It is expected that service will be restored by 6 PM tonight. We will conduct a full post-mortem on Monday to evaluate our response.

Thanks,
Operational Support

questions.question: What is the root cause of the current operational issue?
options: A fire in the finance office
questions.explanation: Doc A explicitly mentions a 'major regional outage' from the primary internet provider.

questions.question: What should staff do if their work is not location-dependent?
options: Use mobile hotspots or work from home
questions.explanation: Doc A states: 'Staff are requested to switch to mobile hotspots or work from home if their tasks are not location-dependent.'

items.prompt: Exercise 2: BCP Terminology. What does 'RTO' stand for in a Business Continuity context?
items.explanation: Recovery Time Objective (RTO) is the duration within which a process must be restored after a disaster.

items.prompt: Exercise 3: Crisis Stages. During which stage should you conduct a 'post-mortem' evaluation?
items.explanation: Evaluation and post-mortems happen in the 'Post-crisis' stage.

items.prompt: Exercise 4: Operational Chunks. Complete the sentence: 'We have implemented a manual ___ to ensure we can still ___ client payments.'
items.explanation: The standard chunk is 'implement a workaround' and 'process payments'.

items.prompt: Exercise 5: Advanced Passives. Rewrite this sentence using a 'Reporting Passive' (It + is + Verb-ed + that...): 'The manager thinks the backup failed because of a sync error.'
items.modelAnswer: It is thought that the backup failed because of a sync error.

items.prompt: Exercise 6: Personal Passives. Rewrite this sentence using a 'Personal Passive' (Subject + is + Verb-ed + to + Infinitive): 'Experts believe the outage started at midnight.'
items.modelAnswer: The outage is believed to have started at midnight.

items.prompt: Exercise 7: Extracting Action Points. Based on Doc A, list the 3 immediate actions that have been taken or requested.
items.modelAnswer:
1. Triggered the BCP.
2. Implemented a manual workaround for payments.
3. Staff requested to use hotspots or WFH.

items.prompt: Exercise 8: Courtesy Modals. How would you professionally ask the IT lead for an update on the restoration time?
options: Give me the restoration time now.
Could you please provide an estimated ETA for the service restoration?
items.explanation: This option is diplomatic, specific, and uses professional terminology ('ETA', 'restoration').

items.prompt: Exercise 9: Follow-up Email. Write a short update (50-70 words) to your team leader explaining that you are working from home due to the outage and will attend the 2 PM meeting via mobile data.
items.modelAnswer: Hi Sarah, just a quick update to confirm I'm working from home today due to the office connectivity issues. I have implemented a workaround using my mobile hotspot and will be able to attend the 2 PM sync as planned. I expect to be fully back on the corporate VPN once service is restored. Thanks, [Your Name]

items.prompt: Exercise 10: Business as Usual. What does the acronym 'BAU' stand for in operational management?
items.explanation: BAU (Business As Usual) refers to normal day-to-day operations.

items.prompt: Exercise 11: Oral Briefing. Record a 2-minute audio briefing explaining the 'workaround' for a system failure to a colleague. Use at least one reporting passive (e.g., 'It is expected that...').
items.modelAnswer: [Audio Upload Required] Rubric: Clarity, Use of terms (workaround, BCP), Professional tone.

items.prompt: Exercise 12: Oral Post-Mortem. Record a 60-second summary of a past operational failure. Use the personal passive (e.g., 'The error is believed to have been caused by...').
items.modelAnswer: [Audio Upload Required] Checklist: Personal passive, Factual tone, Identification of root cause.

items.prompt: Exercise 13: Crisis Incident Report (Portfolio). Draft a formal incident report (150-180 words) for a hypothetical server crash. Include: Timeline, Impact, Workaround, and Root Cause (using advanced passives).
items.modelAnswer:
Incident Report: Server Cluster Failure

At 09:15 AM on Monday, the primary server cluster experienced a critical failure, resulting in a total shutdown of the internal CRM. It is reported that over 200 staff were unable to access client data during this time.

Immediate response: The IT team triggered the Disaster Recovery protocol at 09:30 AM. A workaround was implemented by 10:00 AM, allowing staff to use the read-only backup system. Full service is believed to have been restored by 1:00 PM.

Root Cause Analysis: It is thought that a hardware malfunction in the cooling system led to overheating. The server is said to have been overdue for a scheduled maintenance check.

Recommendations: Update the BCP to include automated alerts for temperature fluctuations and ensure maintenance schedules are strictly followed to maintain BAU.

items.prompt: Exercise 14: BCP Template. Fill in a BCP template for an 'Office Power Cut'. Include: Trigger, Immediate Action, Alternative Site, and Communication Channel.
items.modelAnswer: Trigger: Power outage lasting > 15 mins. Immediate Action: Switch to UPS for critical servers. Alternative Site: Home working / Regional hub. Communication: WhatsApp / Slack via mobile data.

items.prompt: Exercise 15: Weekly Mini-test. 1) Define 'Workaround'. 2) What does 'post-mortem' mean in this context? 3) Complete: 'The system is said ___ have crashed.' 4) What is the difference between RTO and BAU?
items.modelAnswer: 1) A temporary solution. 2) An analysis of an event after it's over. 3) ...to... 4) RTO is a recovery goal; BAU is normal operation.
